data.title: Can't open editors in dev mode
data.body: Tabs show up empty and mini editors show up as 1px high.

data.title: Closing spec windows quit Atom
data.body:
On Windows 8.1
1. Open a package
2. Run the package specs from the View menu
3. Close the spec window

Atom quits at this point, I'd expect the spec window to close without quitting the app.

data.title: 32 bit linux support
data.body:
The build scripts currently produce a 64 bit binary.

What would be needed to add 32 bit support?

Is there any significant code that is 64-bit only? Or is it just a build issue?

data.title: "Reveal in Tree  View" does not work in "Project Find Results"
data.body:
I have searched for a string in the project, which results in a list of results. Right-clicking a result gives option "Reveal in Tree View", which I assume should highlight the file it was found in the project tree view.

However it only moves the focus to the tree view. It does not matter if the tree is collapsed or not. Even if the file is visible, it does not get selected.

The same problem seems to affect "Reveal in Tree View" in the context-menu for the active tab.

data.title: Fix cursor and selection positioning when changing line height, font size, and font family
data.body:
In addition to fixing selection/cursor updates, this PR aims to clean up measurement and perform the minimal number of updates in response to changes that affect the line height and character width.

My goal is to centralize all decisions about measurement in the `EditorComponent` rather than scattering them through `componentDidUpdate` callbacks like they are currently. This will allow us to perform measurements when the line height, font size, and font family change without updating any components except the root component. Previously we were updating the lines component just to perform measurement, which resulting in multiple wasted update passes per change. This PR also batches the updates resulting from measurement together.

data.title: Atom wont display on windows
data.body: Whenever I open Atom, it wont show any window, and when i hover over the icon at the bottom, it just shows the toolbar, not the window. I have the latest source code compiled. Any fixes? Plz answer quickly.

data.title: Can't write the @-symbol on Windows7 with QWERTZ-keyboard
data.body:
I'm having a problem.
I can't write the **@-symbol** anywhere in the atom interface. I'm on Windows7. To write a **@** I need to press **AltGr+Q** (I use a _QWERTZ_-keyboard, AltGr is the right Alt key). I can write the **euro-symbol** (€) which is **AltGr+E**.

Also when I want to write the **-symbol** it collapses comments. (I don't know if this is related.) To write a **\** I have to press **AltGr+?**.

data.title: Merge EditorScrollViewComponent into EditorComponent
data.body: It isn't carrying its weight as a separate component. Every component adds overhead in React, and I actually think a shallower component tree feels a bit more straightforward.

data.title: Unable to upgrade built-in packages
data.body:
### System Configuration

**OS:** Windows 8.1 pro
**LANG:** Traditional Chinese
**node version:** node-v0.10.28-x86
**python version:** 2.7.6
**MSVC:** With both 2010 and 2013 pro version installed
**Atom version:** 0.100.0-00987f3
### Step to reproduce
1. open atom
2. File->Preference->Packages
### Actual Behavior

Available Updates shows "All of your installed packages are up to date!"
### Expect Behavior

Shouldn't the built-in packages be able to upgrade too?
Find And Replace 0.106.0->0.110.0
Fuzzy Finder 0.51.0->0.54.0

Note: I'm not trying to build any newest master again cause the packages will be updated too.

data.title: Emit tokenized-lines signal if lines tokenized
data.body:
Enables grammar developers to inject scope names on a higher level.
This would enable grammars for like restructured text and markdodwn
to insert correct scopenames for constructs like:

```
    Headline
    ========
```

Usually it would be tokenized as

``` json
   [ [ value: "Headline", scopes: [ 'text.restructuredtext', 'meta.paragraph.restructuredtext' ],
    [ value: "========", scopes: ["text.restructuredtext", "meta.paragraph.restructuredtext", "markup.heading.restructuredtext", "punctuation.definition.heading.restructuredtext"]  ]
```

Having the opportunity to look at tokenization on a multiline-base, you can insert "markup.heading.restructuredtext" at
headlines marked as paragraphs.

Some sort of loader should be there while searching packages.

data.title: Shift+backspace and shift+delete by default.
data.body: When working in a caps-lock free environment it's rather hard on the fingers (IMO) and unintuitive (again IMO) to have to unshift just to delete and backspace.  It would be nice to have Atom automatically alias backspace to shift+backspace and delete to shift+delete so if we are working with shift we don't have to move a finger just to backspace or delete.

data.title: Native menu item locations?
data.body: It took me a second to figure out where "Settings" was because it was in File and I never go into the "File" menu at all, can we please get native item locations for Menu's?  On Linux "Settings" or "Preferences" is normally located in Edit and on Windows it's typically located in "Tools".

Right now there is absolutely no way to move between them without using mouse.

data.title: WIP: Split up gutter into multiple components
data.body:
This is very very much a WIP / experiment. 

This is all it does right now. I have git diff displaying another gutter. 

![screen shot 2014-05-30 at 5 24 25 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/3137683/00bef802-e85a-11e3-904b-da47b44f9fc2.png)

This is what my git-diff looks like.

``` coffee
{$, GutterComponent} = require 'atom'

module.exports =
class ReactGitDiffView
  constructor: (@editorView) ->
    editorView.registerComponent (options) ->
      GutterComponent $.extend {ref: 'gitGutter'}, options
```

The idea is that git diff will use it's own gutter component. minimap could use this mechanism, the fold + bookmarks icon, and any other gutter decorations could use one as well. 

@probablycorey check it. @nathansobo, I'm probably crazy.

data.title: Fix line duplication in React editor
data.body:
I tracked down the source of occasional duplicate lines. To prevent jerking to a stop when the target of a mouse wheel event is removed from the DOM, I preserve the screen row associated with the latest mouse wheel.

There were some situations in which the `mouseWheelScreenRow` wasn't getting cleared or was being set unnecessarily, so I fixed those. I also never preserve a line associated with the `mouseWheelScreenRow` if it's in the rendered row range.

It's still possible to set the `mouseWheelScreenRow` without it getting cleared by scrolling up/down at the beginning/end of the file and not actually causing the scroll position to change. I'd like to get a fix in for that before merging this.

data.title: Making a selections sometimes causes the cursor to stop responding

I can reproduce this after clicking around for about 10-20 seconds.
